required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Commercial Cosmetic Mouth Rinse on Plaque Re-growth
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study to Evaluate the Effect of a Commercial Cosmetic Mouth Rinse on Plaque Re-growth

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical study to evaluate the effect of a commercial mouth rinse on plaque re-growth

primary_outcome.measure: Plaque Index of Test Mouth Rinse Versus Sterile Water After Day 4 of Treatment Administration
primary_outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plaque Index Score of Test Mouth Rinse Versus Chlorhexidine Mouth Rinse After Day 4 of Treatment Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.

secondary_outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interproximal Plaque Index After Day 4 of Treatment Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interproximal Plaque Index After 24 Hours of Treatment Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Good general and oral health
- At least 20 natural gradable teeth
- Mean plaque score (Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index) of greater than or equal to 2.00 at the first baseline visit

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 31 participants screened, 23 were randomized. 8 enrolled participants were excluded from trial before assignment to groups (3 did not meet the study criterion; remaining 5 were excluded due to other reasons).

group.title: Test Mouth Rinse
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 milliliters (mL) of commercially available test mouth rinse for 60 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

group.title: Chlorhexidine Mouth Rinse (0.12%)
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 mL of commercially available 0.12% weight by volume (w/v) chlorhexidine mouth rinse for 30 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

group.title: Sterile Water
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 mL of sterile water for 60 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

participants_list.participants: Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 1
Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 1
Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 1
Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 2
Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 2
Due to crossover design,a different set of participants received this treatment compared to Period 2

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants were included for baseline parameters evaluation.

measure.title: Mean Plaque Index Score
measure.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque;1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 millimeter [mm] or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. Plaque Index was calculated by taking average of scores over all tooth sites for a participant.

outcome.title: Plaque Index of Test Mouth Rinse Versus Sterile Water After Day 4 of Treatment Administration
outcome.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. The interproximal plaque index was calculated by taking the average of plaque scores over the mesiofacial, distofacial, mesiolingual and distolingual surfaces in the upper and lower jaws for a participant.
outcome.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who received study treatment and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement. Due to drop outs, there was difference in number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure. Missing data was not imputed.

group.title: Test Mouth Rinse
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 mL of commercially available test mouth rinse for 60 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

group.title: Sterile Water
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 mL of sterile water for 60 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

measure.description: Plaque scores were assessed using Turesky Modification of the Quigley Hein Index and categorized as 0: No plaque; 1: Slight flecks of plaque at the cervical margin of the tooth;2: A thin continuous band of plaque (1 mm or smaller) at the cervical margin of the tooth;3: A band of plaque wider than 1 mm but covering less than 1/3 of the crown of the tooth;4: Plaque covering at least 1/3 but less than 2/3 of the crown of the tooth;5: Plaque covering 2/3 or more of the crown of the tooth. measure.population: Intention to Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who received study treatment and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement. Due to drop outs, there was difference in number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure. Missing data was not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis was no difference between treatments being compared.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment for multiple comparisons were made as the primary comparison was pre-defined.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with factors for treatment, period and subject (random) with baseline as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is first named treatment minus second named treatment such that a negative difference favours the first named treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events encountered or spontaneously reported following administration of any investigational product (including washout product), or for up to 5 days after the last administration of investigational product were recorded.

group.title: Test Mouth Rinse
group.description: Participants swirled their oral cavity with 15 mL of commercially available test mouth rinse for 60 seconds and expectorated. Each treatment was administered twice daily for 4 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
